page.title: 06Fruit and Sugar Beet
page.content:
Strawberies are a common summer crop, and many local people (including children !) pick them in season.
A pupil writes: I like picking strawberries becaue I eat them when I get half way down the row. When I get home, I often have strawberry stains on my clothes. My mum makes strawberry wine.
Between the village and Kings Lynn is a large sugar beet factory, and many local farms supply it, though they may have their total crop size regulated by government quota rules.
A pupil writes: Sugar beet is a stinking thing. But when it is a sunny day at harvesting time, it is more stinking than before.
